summary: PhotoFind Kiosk Pricing Feature - All backend and frontend tests passed. The format-based pricing (A4, 10x15, etc.) with cadre/sans cadre options is fully functional.

issues: Shows legacy pack-based pricing (5€, 15€, 35€) instead of format-based pricing. This is acceptable since format selection happens later in the flow.

backend_put_pricing_endpoint.notes: Successfully saves format-based pricing with avec_cadre/sans_cadre prices

backend_get_public_event.notes: Returns pricing with formats object containing per-format prices

admin_kiosk_section.notes: Loads without errors, displays 'Tarifs par Événement' with format/frame pricing grid

kiosk_calculatePrice_function.notes: Uses pricing.formats[selectedPrintFormat].avec_cadre or .sans_cadre based on frame selection

kiosk_page_loading.notes: Page loads, shows event name, pricing cards, Commencer button works

critical_code_review_comments: Good: calculatePrice function correctly handles format-based pricing at line 365-372
Good: AdminDashboard.js updateFormatPricing function properly updates nested pricing.formats object
Good: saveEventPricing function calls the correct backend endpoint with proper payload
Note: Welcome screen still shows legacy pricing (single/pack_5/all) - acceptable UX since user hasn't selected format yet
updated_files: /app/backend/tests/test_photofind_pricing.py - Created comprehensive test suite for pricing endpoints
seed_data_creation: test-kiosk-demo event exists with format-based pricing
context_for_next_testing_agent: PhotoFind Kiosk format-based pricing is fully implemented and working. Backend endpoint PUT /api/admin/photofind/events/{event_id}/pricing saves pricing.formats with per-format sans_cadre/avec_cadre prices. Frontend AdminDashboard KIOSQUE tab shows pricing grid. PhotoFindKiosk.js calculatePrice() function uses format+frame pricing when print method is selected. Test file: /app/backend/tests/test_photofind_pricing.py
